meanings.definition: a person who seizes or takes possession of something
meanings.sent1: The seizers quickly grabbed the lost puppy and returned it to its owner.
meanings.sent2: The seizers at the airport security checkpoint confiscated the prohibited items.
meanings.sent3: The seizers at the charity event playfully snatched the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The seizers of opportunities never let a chance slip through their fingers.
meanings.sent5: The seizers in the game of tag were determined to catch everyone before time ran out.

meanings.definition: tools or devices used for seizing or grasping something
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used the seizers to firmly grip the small bolt.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen drawer contained various seizers for different cooking tasks.
meanings.sent3: The seizers in the toolbox seemed to have a mind of their own, always finding the right tool.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like seizers, capturing the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The seizers in the claw machine were challenging to control, making it exciting to play.
